Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Level Description: Developing: Emerging understanding, basic elements shown.
CAN: The student can draw two pictures of the same plant species but may only show basic differences between them, like a drooping plant versus a standing plant.
The student can illustrate the plant with water as generally healthy, like using green color for leaves, but might not consistently depict details like a strong stem.
The student can attempt to use symbols or colors to indicate the presence of water, like drawing water droplets in one scene.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to accurately depict a wilted or shriveled plant without water and might show just a slightly less green plant (student may not fully understand the effects of no water).
The student may forget to include or inconsistently draw elements like the sun that indicate the plant also needs light.
Symbols or colors might be used inconsistently or incorrectly to show the presence or absence of water (e.g., could show blue symbols on both or none).
